title: Broccoli & Kale Polenta with Turkey breast
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 190°C.
Toss broccoli and kale with half the olive oil, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season turkey breast and place on the tray. Air-fry for 35 min, turning once.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Turkey for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Lean beef mince and Onion
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix lean beef mince with garam masala and a pinch of salt.
Layer with onion, mushrooms and polenta.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Lean for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Italian High-Protein Yogurt Bowl with Courgette & Quinoa
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat walnuts in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook greek yogurt (0%) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry courgette and peppers with harissa 4 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the quinoa according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Quinoa or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Toss mushrooms and asparagus with half the olive oil, salt, pepper and smoked paprika + cumin; spread on a tray.
Season tempeh and place on the tray. Roast for 24 min, turning once.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tofu (firm) Smoked paprika + cumin bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook tofu (firm) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry green beans and onion with smoked paprika + cumin 14 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Irish Pork tenderloin traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C.
Toss broccoli and peas with half the butter, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season pork tenderloin and place on the tray. Air-fry for 36 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Pork for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Bangladeshi Chicken breast with Spaghetti & Cabbage
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat ghee in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry cabbage and green beans with italian herbs 32 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Spaghetti or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Chicken breast Ras el hanout plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat walnuts in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry asparagus and cabbage with ras el hanout 31 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Greek Prawns traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Toss broccoli and cherry tomatoes with half the tahini, salt, pepper and smoked paprika + cumin; spread on a tray.
Season prawns and place on the tray. Roast for 28 min, turning once.
Cook sweet potato until tender (18–25 min roasted).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tofu (firm) Ras el hanout plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat rapeseed oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook tofu (firm) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and asparagus with ras el hanout 21 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
